newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH PAPER UNION WANTS FAIR PROFIT SHARE - PAPER.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH PAPER UNION WANTS FAIR PROFIT SHARE - PAPER.

text.p: Finnish paper workers want substantial pay hikes next year, reflecting profits in the forest industry, Finnish daily Aamulehti reported on Friday.

The Paper Workers' Union feels that workers have refrained from the hikes they deserve and is now prepared to sacrifice solidarity with other unions, it quoted union chairman Jarmo Lahteenmaki as saying.

"If the Paper Workers' Union for long refrains from taking its share of profits in the sector, the division of income between labour and capital becomes unfair," the paper quoted Lahteenmaki as saying.

Ahead of the previous national incomes settlement talks in autumn 1995, which led to moderate pay hikes across the board, the Paper Workers' Union voiced similar concerns about earnings and pay in the sector, but eventually joined the comprehensive two-year agreement.
